refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Common data types used across HarfBuzz are defined here.

refsect2.title: HB_TAG()
refsect2.para: Constructs an hb_tag_t from four character literals.

refsect2.title: HB_UNTAG()
refsect2.para: Extracts four character literals from an hb_tag_t.
Since: 0.6.0

refsect2.title: hb_tag_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Converts a string into an hb_tag_t. Valid tags are four characters. Shorter input strings will be padded with spaces. Longer input strings will be truncated.

entry.para: Length of str , or -1 if it is NULL-terminated

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_tag_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Converts an hb_tag_t to a string and returns it in buf . Strings will be four characters long.
Since: 0.9.5

refsect2.title: hb_direction_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Converts a string to an hb_direction_t.
Matching is loose and applies only to the first letter. For examples, "LTR" and "left-to-right" will both return HB_DIRECTION_LTR.
Unmatched strings will return HB_DIRECTION_INVALID.

entry.para: Length of str , or -1 if it is NULL-terminated

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_direction_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Converts an hb_direction_t to a string.
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: HB_DIRECTION_REVERSE()
refsect2.para: Reverses a text direction. Requires that the direction be valid.

refsect2.title: HB_DIRECTION_IS_BACKWARD()
refsect2.para: Tests whether a text direction moves backward (from right to left, or from bottom to top). Requires that the direction be valid.

refsect2.title: HB_DIRECTION_IS_FORWARD()
refsect2.para: Tests whether a text direction moves forward (from left to right, or from top to bottom). Requires that the direction be valid.

refsect2.title: HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL()
refsect2.para: Tests whether a text direction is horizontal. Requires that the direction be valid.

refsect2.title: HB_DIRECTION_IS_VALID()
refsect2.para: Tests whether a text direction is valid.

refsect2.title: HB_DIRECTION_IS_VERTICAL()
refsect2.para: Tests whether a text direction is vertical. Requires that the direction be valid.

refsect2.title: hb_script_from_iso15924_tag ()
refsect2.para: Converts an ISO 15924 script tag to a corresponding hb_script_t.

entry.para: an hb_tag_t representing an ISO 15924 tag.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: An hb_script_t corresponding to the ISO 15924 tag.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_script_to_iso15924_tag ()
refsect2.para: Converts an hb_script_t to a corresponding ISO 15924 script tag.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: An hb_tag_t representing an ISO 15924 script tag.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_script_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Converts a string str representing an ISO 15924 script tag to a corresponding hb_script_t. Shorthand for hb_tag_from_string() then hb_script_from_iso15924_tag().

entry.para: a string representing an ISO 15924 tag.
length of the str , or -1 if it is NULL-terminated.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: An hb_script_t corresponding to the ISO 15924 tag.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_script_get_horizontal_direction ()
refsect2.para: Fetches the hb_direction_t of a script when it is set horizontally. All right-to-left scripts will return HB_DIRECTION_RTL. All left-to-right scripts will return HB_DIRECTION_LTR. Scripts that can be written either horizontally or vertically will return HB_DIRECTION_INVALID. Unknown scripts will return HB_DIRECTION_LTR.
Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_language_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Converts str representing a BCP 47 language tag to the corresponding hb_language_t.

entry.para: a string representing a BCP 47 language tag.
length of the str , or -1 if it is NULL-terminated.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The hb_language_t corresponding to the BCP 47 language tag.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_language_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Converts an hb_language_t to a string.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A NULL-terminated string representing the language . Must not be freed by the caller.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_language_get_default ()
refsect2.para: Fetch the default language from current locale.
refsect2.note: Note that the first time this function is called, it calls "setlocale (LC_CTYPE, nullptr)" to fetch current locale. The underlying setlocale function is, in many implementations, NOT threadsafe. To avoid problems, call this function once before multiple threads can call it. This function is only used from hb_buffer_guess_segment_properties() by HarfBuzz itself.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The default language of the locale as an hb_language_t.

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.2

refsect2.title: hb_language_matches ()
refsect2.para: Check whether a second language tag is the same or a more specific version of the provided language tag. For example, "fa_IR.utf8" is a more specific tag for "fa" or for "fa_IR".

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if languages match, false otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since: 5.0.0

refsect2.title: hb_feature_from_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_bool_t hb_feature_from_string (const char *str, int len, hb_feature_t *feature);
refsect2.para: Parses a string into a hb_feature_t.

The format for specifying feature strings follows. All valid CSS font-feature-settings values other than 'normal' and the global values are also accepted, though not documented below. CSS string escapes are not supported.
The range indices refer to the positions between Unicode characters. The position before the first character is always 0.
The format is Python-esque. Here is how it all works:

entry.para: length of str , or -1 if string is NULL terminated
the hb_feature_t to initialize with the parsed values.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if str is successfully parsed, false otherwise

refsect2.para: Since: 0.9.5

refsect2.title: hb_feature_to_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_feature_to_string (hb_feature_t *feature, char *buf, unsigned int size);
refsect2.para: Converts a hb_feature_t into a NULL-terminated string in the format understood by hb_feature_from_string(). The client in responsible for allocating big enough size for buf , 128 bytes is more than enough.
Since: 0.9.5

refsect2.title: hb_variation_from_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: hb_bool_t hb_variation_from_string (const char *str, int len, hb_variation_t *variation);
refsect2.para: Parses a string into a hb_variation_t.
The format for specifying variation settings follows. All valid CSS font-variation-settings values other than 'normal' and 'inherited' are also accepted, though, not documented below.
The format is a tag, optionally followed by an equals sign, followed by a number. For example wght=500, or slnt=-7.5.

entry.para: length of str , or -1 if string is NULL terminated
the hb_variation_t to initialize with the parsed values.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: true if str is successfully parsed, false otherwise

refsect2.para: Since: 1.4.2

refsect2.title: hb_variation_to_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: void hb_variation_to_string (hb_variation_t *variation, char *buf, unsigned int size);
refsect2.para: Converts an hb_variation_t into a NULL-terminated string in the format understood by hb_variation_from_string(). The client in responsible for allocating big enough size for buf , 128 bytes is more than enough.
Since: 1.4.2

refsect2.title: hb_destroy_func_t ()
refsect2.para: A virtual method for destroy user-data callbacks.

refsect2.title: hb_bool_t
refsect2.para: Data type for booleans.

refsect2.title: hb_codepoint_t
refsect2.para: Data type for holding Unicode codepoints. Also used to hold glyph IDs.

refsect2.title: HB_CODEPOINT_INVALID
refsect2.para: Unused hb_codepoint_t value.
Since: 8.0.0

refsect2.title: enum hb_direction_t
refsect2.para: The direction of a text segment or buffer.

A segment can also be tested for horizontal or vertical orientation (irrespective of specific direction) with
HB_DIRECTION_IS_HORIZONTAL() or HB_DIRECTION_IS_VERTICAL().

entry.para: Text is set horizontally from left to right.
Text is set horizontally from right to left.
Text is set vertically from top to bottom.
Text is set vertically from bottom to top.

refsect2.title: hb_language_t
refsect2.para: Data type for languages. Each hb_language_t corresponds to a BCP 47 language tag.

refsect2.title: hb_feature_t
refsect2.para: The hb_feature_t is the structure that holds information about requested feature application. The feature will be applied with the given value to all glyphs which are in clusters between start (inclusive) and end (exclusive). Setting start to HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_START and end to HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_END specifies that the feature always applies to the entire buffer.

entry.para: The hb_tag_t tag of the feature
The value of the feature. 0 disables the feature, non-zero (usually 1) enables the feature. For features implemented as lookup type 3 (like 'salt') the value is a one based index into the alternates.
the cluster to start applying this feature setting (inclusive).
the cluster to end applying this feature setting (exclusive).

refsect2.title: hb_variation_t
refsect2.para: Data type for holding variation data. Registered OpenType variation-axis tags are listed in OpenType Axis Tag Registry.

entry.para: The hb_tag_t tag of the variation-axis name
The value of the variation axis

refsect2.para: Since: 1.4.2

refsect2.title: hb_mask_t
refsect2.para: Data type for bitmasks.

refsect2.title: hb_position_t
refsect2.para: Data type for holding a single coordinate value. Contour points and other multi-dimensional data are stored as tuples of hb_position_t's.

refsect2.title: hb_tag_t
refsect2.para: Data type for tag identifiers. Tags are four byte integers, each byte representing a character.
Tags are used to identify tables, design-variation axes, scripts, languages, font features, and baselines with human-readable names.

refsect2.title: enum hb_script_t
refsect2.para: Data type for scripts. Each hb_script_t's value is an hb_tag_t corresponding to the four-letter values defined by ISO 15924.
See also the Script (sc) property of the Unicode Character Database.

refsect2.title: hb_user_data_key_t
refsect2.para: Data structure for holding user-data keys.

refsect2.title: HB_TAG_NONE
refsect2.para: Unset hb_tag_t.

refsect2.title: HB_TAG_MAX
refsect2.para: Maximum possible unsigned hb_tag_t.
Since: 0.9.26

refsect2.title: HB_TAG_MAX_SIGNED
refsect2.para: Maximum possible signed hb_tag_t.
Since: 0.9.33

refsect2.title: HB_LANGUAGE_INVALID
refsect2.para: An unset hb_language_t.
Since: 0.6.0

refsect2.title: HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_END
refsect2.para: Special setting for hb_feature_t.end to apply the feature from to the end of the buffer.
Since: 2.0.0

refsect2.title: HB_FEATURE_GLOBAL_START
refsect2.para: Special setting for hb_feature_t.start to apply the feature from the start of the buffer.
Since: 2.0.0
